demesstify.analysis package

Submodules

demesstify.analysis.attachments module

Provides functionality for tracking and analyzing the attachments that were exchanged in a given message conversation.

class demesstify.analysis.attachments.Attachment(data: DataFrame)

Bases: object

Analyzes attachments data.

get_attachments_with_filetype(extension: str) → DataFrame

Gets the attachments dataframe filtered by the specified filetype.

get_average_per_day() → float

Calculates the average number of attachments exchanged in a day.

get_count_of_days_with_attachments() → int

Calculates the number of days where attachments were exchanged.

get_count_of_days_without_attachments() → int

Calculates the number of days where no attachments were exchanged.

get_count_of_filetype(extension: str) → int

Calculates the number of attachments with the specified filetype.

get_datetime_of_longest_silence() → datetime

Calculates the datetime of the longest time between attachments.

get_days_since_first_attachment(ceiling: bool = True) → int

Calculates the number of days since the first attachment.

By default, this method will round the number of days up by taking the ceiling of the Timedelta object. If this is not desired, set the ceiling parameter to False.

get_least_per_day() → float

Calculates the least number of attachments in a day.

get_longest_silence() → timedelta

Calculates the longest time between attachments.

get_most_per_day() → float

Calculates the greatest number of attachments in a day.

get_total() → int

Calculates the total number of attachments exchanged.

class demesstify.analysis.attachments.Attachments(path: Optional[str] = None, handle_id: Optional[int] = None, phone: Optional[str] = None, email: Optional[str] = None)

Bases: object

Tracks and analyzes attachments from the local iMessage database.

Properties:
path:

The filepath to the local iMessage database.

Gets the attachments dataframe.

get_all() → DataFrame

Gets the unfiltered attachments dataframe.

get_received() → DataFrame

Gets the attachments dataframe filtered by received messages.

get_sent() → DataFrame

Gets the attachments dataframe filtered by sent messages.

property path: Optional[str]

Gets the location of the iMessage database.

demesstify.analysis.emojis module

demesstify.analysis.text module

Provides functionality for tracking and analyzing the reactions that occur in a given message conversation.

class demesstify.analysis.text.Text(data: DataFrame)

Bases: object

Generates useful calculations about given message data.

get_average_length() → float

Calculates the average length of individual messages.

get_average_per_day() → float

Calculates the average number of texts exchanged in a day.

get_count_of_days_with_messages() → int

Calculates the number of days where messages were exchanged.

get_count_of_days_without_messages() → int

Calculates the number of days where no messages were exchanged.

get_count_of_substring(substring: str) → int

Calculates the number of occurrences of a substring.

get_datetime_of_longest_silence() → datetime

Calculates the datetime of the longest time between messages.

get_days_since_first_message(ceiling: bool = True) → int

Calculates the number of days since the first message.

By default, this method will round the number of days up by taking the ceiling of the Timedelta object. If this is not desired, set the ceiling parameter to False.

get_least_per_day() → float

Calculates the least number of texts exchanged in a day.

get_longest_silence() → timedelta

Calculates the longest time between messages.

get_most_consecutive() → int

Calculates the most messages exchanged unidirectionally in a row.

This method only works when the data includes all messages, i.e. is not filtered by directionality.

get_most_per_day() → float

Calculates the greatest number of texts exchanged in a day.

get_total() → float

Calculates the total number of messages exchanged.
